question: Who become the chief of Press Council of India for the second time?
explanation: Justice C K Prasad is likely to become the chief of Press Council of India for the second time. A committee of three members headed by Vice-President Venkaiah Naidu has given their approval for his appointment for a second term. He has been the chief of PCI for three yearsfrom November 2014. He has earlier replaced Justice Markaday Katju.
